intro: Quararibea caldasiana, commonly known as the Caldasian quina, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for the treatment of fever and inflammation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
